name: Reference - Ferris Road Track & Civil IFC Drawing Set MRP-DPK-103-00-CPW-0060, MRP-DPK-103-00-CPW-0063
Reference - NIST-2650 Rail Use Laying and Adjustment
Reference - NIFO-2690.3 Certificate of Track for Operation
2.01 - Obtain and submit Material Certificate of Compliance for Track Materials;
Reference - IFC Drawing(s), Track Constrction Site Mudmap, Bill of Materials
Acceptance Criteria - Units to be free from damage, total and types of units for full set validated No signs of discoloration
Verifying Documents - ConQA Hold Point Release
2.02 - Submit Welding Procedure/welding qualification welders Record
Reference - NIST-2650 Rail, AS 1085.20 Welding Rail Steels
Acceptance Criteria - Qualified personnel & welding accordance with manufacturers specs.
Verifying Documents - ConQA Hold Point Release
Acceptance Criteria - No damage or debris on components
○ Validate total number and type of components matches drawing
2.04 - Confirm extent of track removal required for civil works
Reference - IFC Drawing(s), Track Constrction Site Mudmap
Acceptance Criteria - Extent of civil works and subsequent track removal to be confirmed in conjunction with MRPA civil team, limits of removal to be marked up on site
○ Pre-removal survey of existing track alignment
3.01 - Deconstruct and remove track componends, including rail, sleepers, jewellery & ballast. Stockpile materials as required for reuse during construction
Reference - IFC Drawing(s), Track Constrction Site Mudmap
Acceptance Criteria - Track structure to be removed to the designated limits as identified.
○ Visual confirmation of removal on site
3.02 - Earthworks completed and site handed over from Civil Contractor
Acceptance Criteria - Confirmation of completion of underlying ITP(s)
Acceptance Criteria - Overal Minimum 300mm bottom ballast depth

○ Ballast to be placed in 150mm max layers. Layers to be compacted with 10 tonne smooth drum vibrating roller with minimum 3 passes, in areas where wheeled roller cannot access, ballast to be compated using a vibratory compaction plate
○ Bottom Ballast to be left 20mm below final design level
○ Attach Site Photo: Installed Bottom Ballast Layer
Responsibility - Track Surveyor, Track Supervisor, Site/Project Engineer
Acceptance Criteria - Sleepers square at nominal 685mm +/-25mm for open track
Reference - NIST-2650 Rail, NIST-2651 Sleepers and Fastenings

Acceptance Criteria - All rail sitting within Sleeper footing with correct sleeper insulators, rail ends positioned the midpoint of sleeper bays +/-50mm, no rail ends to be located within 3m of existing track welds, rail fastenings installed
○ New Rail lengths installed to be as per approved Ferris Road Rail Weld Plan
○ Gauge of track to be checked upon installation of fastenings
– Rail joint to exisiting weld measurement
– Rail joint between sleeper bay measurements
Reference - NIST-2630 Track Construction, NIST-2706 Track Geometry
Acceptance Criteria - Tamping Ensures Track Geometry Tolerances are not breached (dimentions are in mm);
○ Survey measurment of RL of top of rail head
○ A minimum horizontal clearance of 3.0m from track centreline to structure.
Responsibility - Track Surveyor, Track Supervisor, Site/Project Engineer
Reference - NIST-2630 Track Construction, NIST-2706 Track Geometry
Acceptance Criteria - Ballast shoulder of 400mm width from outer edge of sleeper and with 1:1.5 angle of repose thereafter
○ No Ballast to be on top surface of sleepers or aorund rail Fastenings
– Rubber Panels free of ballast materials
Reference - NIST-2650 Rail, NIFO-2650.5 Aluminothermic Weld Record
Acceptance Criteria - Welds to be lined and finished to alignment standard
○ Verify Aluminothermic welding carried out in accordance with AS1085.20
○ Aluminothermic Weld Return Form to be completed
Responsibility - Track Welder, Track Supervisor, Site/Project Engineer
Reference - NIST-2650 Rail, NIFO-2650.5 Aluminothermic Weld Record
Acceptance Criteria - Stressing Rail in line with V/Line Rail Welding Process
○ Ensure Stressing only performed between rail temperatures; >10 and <38 degrees
○ Complete track stressing in 330m module or otherwise as noted on approved track stressing plan
○ Reference Marks recorded pre and post tensing of rail
○ Aluminothermic Weld Return Form to be completed
Responsibility - Track Welder, Track Supervisor, Site/Project Engineer
Reference - NIST-2650 Rail, NIFO-2650.5 Aluminothermic Weld Record
Acceptance Criteria - Ultrasonic testing to be carried out in accordance with NIST-2650 Rail
○ The cross section of the area of the head and web shall be completely scanned;
– The foot area shall be scanned in accordance with AS 1085.11 Permanent Way Material – Head-hardened Rail, Figure C2.
– Welds shall be scanned to both directions.
○ Final weld geometry to be assessed
○ Aluminothermic Weld Return Form to be completed
Responsibility - Weld Tester, Track Supervisor, Site/Project Engineer
3.11 - Installation of Guard Rail & Guard Rail Nose
Acceptance Criteria - Install guard rail and guard rail nose as per IFC design
○ Guardrail to be installed with alternating fastening pattern
○ Guardrail to be isntalled at lengths of either 13.7m, 19.9m or 27.5m, joints to be gap adjusted and plate & bolted upon completion
Acceptance Criteria - Survey activities undertaken to validate correct construction
Reference - NIFO-2690.3 Certificate of Track for Operation
Frequency - Once when all occupation works complete
Verifying Documents - ConQA Hold Point Release

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
